result.execSummary:
The defendant James D Minturn Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a forfeiture of $100.00 including all costs and surcharges by 6-15-2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James D Minturn Jr

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant James D Minturn not in court, in custody.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Theft, Co. Ord. 63.042 to which defendant pled no contest.
Court found defendant guilty and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100.00 including all costs and surcharges by 6/15/23.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant James D Minturn not in court, in custody.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Romenesko requests a plea and sentencing date as the defendant has been offered a ticket.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant James D Minturn not in court, in custody.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Romenesko has just been appointed and has not received discovery or an offer.  Atty. Romenesko requests a status conference date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K. A.

Defendant James D Minturn in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant James D Minturn in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James D Minturn appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
